definition[0]: to gradually become slower, weaker, less active etc, or to make something do this
example[0]: The heavy rain showed no signs of slackening off.
example[1]: Guy slackened his pace as he approached the gate.
definition[1]: to make something looser, or to become looser
example[2]: He did not let her go, but his grip on her slackened.
definition[2]: to gradually become weaker or less active, or to make something do this
example[3]: As business slackens, accounting firms are reducing their professional staffs and shaking up office leadership.
example[4]: Industrialdemand hasslackened off because of the worldwide economic slowdown.
example[5]: The ending of a special tax incentive is widely expected toslacken the pace of new car purchases.
